doc:
Dot Farley https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dot_Farley 0 Dot Farley (February 6, 1881 – May 2, 1971) was an American film actress. She appeared in 280 films between 1910 and 1950. Mainly known for her roles in short comedies, prolific with Mack Sennett in the silent days; she was later notable as the mother-in-law of Edgar Kennedy in most of his series of short films at the RKO studios. She was born in Chicago, Illinois and died in South Pasadena, California. Dot Farley ( February_6_,_1881 – May_2 , 1971 ) was an_American_film_actress . She appeared in 280_films between 1910_and_1950 . Mainly known for her_roles in short_comedies , prolific with Mack_Sennett in the_silent_days ; she was later_notable as the_mother-in-law of Edgar_Kennedy in most of his_series of short_films at the_RKO_studios . She was_born in Chicago , Illinois and died in South_Pasadena , California .
